Parameters: String: File suffix that can be handled by this DRM plug-in. it could be null but not an empty string. When it is null, it indicates that some DRM content comes with no file suffix.
addFileSuffix(java.lang.String).Description: Adds the specified file suffix to the list of file suffixes this DRM plug-in supports.

Parameters: String: Unique description of plug-in. Must not be null or an empty string.
setDescription(java.lang.String).Description: Sets a description for the DRM plug-in (agent).

Parameters: String: MIME type that can be handles by this DRM plug-in. Must not be null or an empty string.
addMimeType(java.lang.String).Description: Adds the specified MIME type to the list of MIME types this DRM plug-in supports.

getDescription().Description: Retrieves the DRM plug-in (agent) description. Even if null or an empty string is not allowed in @B_android#drm#DrmSupportInfo#setDescription_E@, if @B_android#drm#DrmSupportInfo#setDescription_E@ is not called, description returned from this method is an empty string.

getFileSuffixIterator().Description: Retrieves an iterator object that you can use to iterate over the file suffixes that this DRM plug-in supports.

Returns: True if equal; false if not equal.
Parameters: Object: The object to be compared.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Overridden equals implementation. Two DrmSupportInfo objects are considered being equal if they support exactly the same set of mime types, file suffixes, and has exactly the same description.

getMimeTypeIterator().Description: Retrieves an iterator object that you can use to iterate over the MIME types that this DRM plug-in supports.

getDescriprition().Description: The method name is mis-spelled, and it is replaced by @B_android#drm#DrmSupportInfo#getDescription_E@. Retrieves the DRM plug-in (agent) description.
getDescriprition().history: Added in API level 11 Deprecated in API level 16

ClassDesc: An entity class that wraps the capability of each DRM plug-in (agent), such as the MIME type and file suffix the DRM plug-in can handle. Plug-in developers can expose the capability of their plug-in by passing an instance of this class to an application.
